page.title: 20ST. HELENS WHARF,ABINGDON
page.content: This string of buildings consists of The Mill,The Double Alms Houses,The Old Anchor Inn,The Stable,Long Alley Alms Houses and The Malthouse.St.Helens Church, immediately to the rear of these buildings,dominates the area. Barges using the Thames and the adjacent canal,which used to run West to Wantage,would land cargoes of grain, coal,seed,bread and general items.This made the Wharf the centre of the town's commercial activity,during the 18th and 19th centuries. The area now shows little sign of it's past importance.The Anchor Inn and the Alms Houses still perform their original function but the canal was abandoned in 1924.The wharf is now part of the tourist attractions which are so important to the town.
